text: The Apartment is an album led by saxophonist Dexter Gordon recorded in 1974 and released on the Danish SteepleChase label.Dexter Gordon discography, accessed March 17, 2015SteepleChase Records discography, accessed March 17, 2015 ==Reception== In his review for AllMusic, Scott Yanow said "While in Europe, tenor-sax-great Dexter Gordon recorded many sessions with pianist Kenny Drew, bassist Niels Pedersen and drummer Albert "Tootie" Heath. All are worth acquiring and this one is no exception". ==Track listing== All compositions by Dexter Gordon except where noted. # "The Apartment" - 5:57 # "Wee-Dot" (J. J. Johnson) - 7:34 # "Old Folks" (Dedette Lee Hill, Willard Robison) - 7:23 # "Strollin'" (Horace Silver) - 7:53 # "Candlelight Lady" - 8:52 # "Stablemates" (Benny Golson) - 6:04 Bonus track on CD release # "Antabus" - 4:42 ==Personnel== *Dexter Gordon - tenor saxophone *Kenny Drew - piano *Niels-Henning Orsted Pedersen - bass *Albert Heath - drums ==References== Category:1975 albums Category:Dexter Gordon albums Category:SteepleChase Records albums
title: The Apartment (album)
